explanation: To decide if lfs_file_size_ violates the MISRA recursion rule we must follow all call edges originating from lfs_file_size_ and see if any path returns to it. The only callee of lfs_file_size_ is lfs_max, so lfs_max must be inspected (its source/body and any functions it calls) to ensure it does not call (directly or indirectly) lfs_file_size_. The provided static call graph shows lfs_max has no callees, so no further symbols are required. Note: callers of lfs_file_size_ (lfs_file_seek_, lfs_file_truncate_, lfs_file_size) do not need to be inspected for this rule unless lfs_file_size_ itself calls them (which it does not).
